comments:
On M5 RC1 build:

1. Turn off Build on Resource Save preference.
2. Create a new C++ ManagedMake project
3. Create a new Class within that project
4. Search for all class declarations named "*" within workspace.

A dialog box "Search Error" appears:
An error occurred during the Search operation.
See error log for more details

ECLIPSE_HOME/workspace/.metadata/.log contains:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.cdt.core 4 4 Nov 26, 2003 10:29:52.814
!MESSAGE Background Indexer Crash Recovery
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at 
org.eclipse.cdt.managedbuilder.internal.core.ManagedBuildInfo.getIncludePaths
(ManagedBuildInfo.java:362)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.search.indexing.SourceIndexer.indexFile
(SourceIndexer.java:82)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.search.indexing.AbstractIndexer.index
(AbstractIndexer.java:353)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.index.impl.Index.add(Index.java:110)
	at 
org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.search.indexing.AddCompilationUnitToIndex.indexDoc
ument(AddCompilationUnitToIndex.java:29)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.search.indexing.AddFileToIndex.execute
(AddFileToIndex.java:39)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.search.processing.JobManager.run
(JobManager.java:384)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:568)

Changing the priority to P2 to raise the visibility, these defects need to be 
resolved to clear up failed test cases.

I dunno. Whatever changes have been made to getting includes paths dynamically 
and improvements to the search engine seem tohave fixed this problem. I cannot 
duplicate the error.

I'll take your word for it.
Works for me too, on 2.0.0.200406250301.
